intro: Androtrichum speciosum, commonly known as the showy sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure with dense clusters of small, pink or white flowers. The plant typically thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or arid environments. Its leaves are succulent and fleshy, adapted to conserve water in harsh conditions. The showy sandwort is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in rock gardens.
